page.title: 02GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: { VILLAGES:}BURRINGTON,FAMOUS FOR IT'S COMBE, ADJOINS RICKFORD AND BLAGDON IN THE SOUTH. BUTCOMBE, FAMOUS FOR THE LOCAL BREWERY, SITS IN A SMALL VALLEY FEEDING INTO THE LAKE FROM THE NORTH. { VEGETATION:}MAINLY FARM GRASSLAND WITH OPEN HILLSIDE AND CONIFEROUS WOODLAND, WELL MIXED WITH DECIDUOUS WOOD AND PLANTED TREES. { GEOLOGY:}THE OUTER COVER OF THE MENDIPS,WHICH IS CARBONIFEROUS LIMESTONE,INTRUDES ALONG THE SOUTH OF THE BLOCK. ALLUVIUM FILLS THE VALLEY BETWEEN THIS AND HILLS TO THE NORTH. { RECREATION:}THE MENDIPS OFFER CAVING, POTHOLING, ROCKCLIMBING AND HIKING. BLAGDON LAKE IS STOCKED FOR WORLD FAMOUS TROUT FISHING AND PROVIDES A SANCTUARY FOR MANY WATER BIRDS.THE AREA IS ALSO GOOD FOR CYCLING,CAMPING AND HORSERIDING.
